name: SLIPPER 42
notes:
This from Robin Musters: (courtesy of 'sailorman_john')
"The Slipper 42 started life as the RANCHER 41, for which Tyler's Boatyard acquired the molds.
We raised the topsides about a foot and discarded the bolt on keel and spade rudder in favour of internal ballast and a skeg rudder. This converted a racing hull into a cruising boat. As well as the keel and rudder, I drew the interior layout and the new deck."
